page.title: 02FARMS NEAR TEESSIDE AIRPORT
page.content: Farming is the key industry in the Northern part of the survey area.Some of the farmers {own the land}and have farmed here for eg 24,45,101 and 140 years, whilst others are tenants. The majority of farms which have made{changes}during the last 10 years have reduced livestock numbers and increased the amounts of cereals and oil seed rape grown. The reason for this has been that arable farming is more profitable and requires less labour. The European Economic Community also provides{subsidies}for farmers growing certain crops, for example ,oil seed rape, which is sold to make margarine. More{grassland}does occur towards the West, away from urban Teesside, and also around the areas of land close to the airport's runways.
